page.title: 13LOCAL INTERESTING FEATURES.
page.content: Apart from the Church at Little Sampford & Spains Hall there are a number of other interesting features in the area.These include the fords across the river & minor streams & the road bridge at Little Sampford.Of particular interest are the fifteenth century manor house of Tewes & the Roman villa site at Brickstead by the Great Howe Wood.Tewes is a beautiful example of a yeoman's house,timber- framed with overhanging storey and the remains of the old moat.The latter is a common feature of early farmhouses in the area.The excavation of the villa site revealed a typical Roman- British farm complex of the period.A minor feature of interest is the clock on the front elevation of Clock House Farm.It was made by John Petit in 1778.A handsome timber-framed house of 1600 is chequers at Little Bardfield.
